meanings.definition: An extinct genus of herbivorous artiodactyl mammals, closely related to modern camels and llamas, that lived in Europe during the Eocene epoch.
meanings.english_definition: An extinct genus of herbivorous artiodactyl mammals, closely related to modern camels and llamas, that lived in Europe during the Eocene epoch.

examples.sentence: Anoplotheres were common in the forests of Eocene Europe.
examples.translation: アノプロテルスは始新世のヨーロッパの森林によく見られた。

etymology.value: From Ancient Greek ἀν- (an-, “not”) + ὁπλή (hoplḗ, “hoof”) + θήρ (thḗr, “beast”).
